TEI.2.document_title: John Bradley to Stephen F. Austin, 06-30-182

barker_notes.barker_summary: John Bradley to Austin. June 30, 1826. Announcing settlement on certain land.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1365

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*John Bradley to Austin. June 30, 1826. Announcing settlement on certain land.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Brassos */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="06-30-1826">June 30th 1826*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Col Stephen F Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Dear Sir On the *date_mentioned n="03-12-1826">12th of March*/date_mentioned* last I made settlement on the *location_mentioned*12. Labore on the East side of the Brassos*/location_mentioned*. I tooke the liberty of making this Selection. In consequence of an old promise from you, that, I was Intitled to a labour, and should have one when layed of *location_mentioned*near the mouth of the River */location_mentioned*If it meets your approbation. I want you to reserve the labore for me and let no other person have it. I shall be up to town and see you as soon as I can leave my *person_mentioned*family*/person_mentioned*. I remain with Respect*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*John Bradley*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
